data.title: Excellent Chicken Tenders
data.text: They have some great chicken tenders and their sauces are amazing. The blueberry cold slaw is really good and the apples with the dip are special. It is a very clean and refreshing place for a quick lunch.

data.title: Overpriced fast food
data.text: I was excited and curious  to try this place out as I watched it during construction. The staff were very friendly and  courteous.I was a bit disappointed,this was just an over priced fast food restaurant. This salad was nothing to talk about ,the portions was ok and the chicken was plain no frills.No taste. I think I'll pass on this one.

data.title: Not for me
data.text:
I had been saying I'd try this place since I moved to the area a few months ago. On a night when I didn't have time to cook, I went there expecting at least the quality of other comparable restaurants- I won't name names but let's just say it didn't cut the mustard. There was a long line so I expected something great but it wasn't at all.

The tenders are good! However, the fries were cold and greasy.  My son doesn't love fries because he rarely eats them but he requested them that night. The fries were so bad he doesn't even want fries anywhere anymore. I ordered a salad, which was basically a cut up half head of iceberg lettuce with a couple shreds of cheddar cheese and some grape tomato slices. There's a salad place near me that actually is fresh and delicious for the same amount but much better! 

The service was great though- all of the employees I encountered were quite pleasant.

data.title: the best
data.text: If you want to eat the best chicken tenders in your life....go to pdq.That is all you need to know,by far the best...home made.

data.title: too expensive for my taste
data.text: the food quality was good but too expensive for the portions they serve I felt hungry very soon after

data.title: Best Fast Food Chicken
data.text: I am hooked on PDQ! Large and juicy chicken strips that when you bite into them, you know is pure natural chicken white meat. Not greasy, not salty, and both their grilled and breaded strips are delicious. Best nad spun shakes I've had in a long time! Fries arr cut before your eyes, thin potato strips that you can gobble up by the handful. And I've not seen such a cheerful and courteous staff as I've seen there. Highly recommended if you want to wat fast food rhat doesn't taste like fast food.

data.title: Excellent experience!
data.text:
This was a phenomenal experience!  I had the crispy turkey sandwich.  It was piping hot, crispy and juicy.  The portions were also substantial.  The one thing negative was the size of the fries.  My order of fries had a small number of full length fries.  Most were small which made it handle to dip the ketchup.

The furniture/decor was very modern and nice.  They had different seating options from counter top to traditional tables and booths.

I appreciated their 1st of Monday of the month military discount where they offer a 50% discount.

I will DEFINITELY come back to this restaurant.  Especially for the military discount!

data.title: GREAT FOOD
data.text: Highly recommend, food is great, friendly staff, clean place, will defiantly go back. I like the open kitchen feeling in this restaurant you get to see the chefs at work

data.title: Chicken at its finest!!!
data.text: First visit and pleasantly surprised.  So much better than the other chicken nugget place. The atmosphere is much nicer!!!  It's a fast-food restaurant disguised as a sit-down restaurant.  Great concept, great music, tv's and great food!!! Employees are super nice and go out of their way to make your experience the best it can be.

data.title: Great Chicken Tenders
data.text: Not really a fast food restaurant.  Great service, atmosphere, and the chicken is very good.  They make all your chicken to order but do not worry, they get it out quickly.  The small amount of time is worth it.  Nice fresh hot chicken with a variety of sauces to dip them in.   Love the soda dispenser, huge variety of drinks with a large variety of flavors.  Almost forgot!, loving the fries.

data.title: Great service, and good food.
data.text: A coworker and I visited PDQ for lunch.  The restaurant was clean, and very open.  Patrons can easily see into the kitchen where the food is prepared.  I personally value that kind of transparency.  I ordered fingers with buffalo sauce on the side and fries.  The menu has salads for the health conscientious and milk shakes for those who are wanting to splurge.

data.title: Average, nothing special
data.text: Clean, bright, fast service. The food was fresh, but nothing better than chicken tenders from anywhere else. I wouldn't go again.

data.title: As far as fast food goes this is a clear 5-stars
data.text:
Wow. Clued up servers and great food? Please export this chain to the UK!

Eating out with a dairy allergy can be tough and looking at the allergy menu it looked like we were in trouble. Nothing is dairy free. However, the server was very lucid and told me I'm sure they could do something. The manager came out and we had our chicken cooked without dairy. You don't get this service from most American restaurant chains.

The atmosphere is relaxed, the servers intelligent, and the food fresh and tasty. We need more of these.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text: My family and I visited this PDQ by recommendation of someone else that had raved about it. Aside from being ridiculously busy it was fantastic. Great food, even better service. The customer service people that walk around and check on you during your meal were great. They paid extra special attention to our little one and even brought cookies because the apples had pineapple and I'm allergic. A little expensive for fast food but the quality was great. I would go again definitely... Hopefully when it's not so busy.

data.title: very pleasant
data.text: Pdq stands by their name. It's fresh food and many options. The restaurant is colorful and family friendly. The service is fast! Good  food, tasty lemonade, and side options.

data.title: Unique & Friendly
data.text: Very friendly staff! It's like a fast food restaurant with some table service. Nice decor, like that the menus is in two places so if you are in line you can have your order ready by time you get to cash. We had the Cali grilled chicken sandwich, the chicken was not grilled, it was precooked which is fine but at least grill it to warm it up...it was cold and tough. Totally disappointed!! We also ordered a side of chicken tenders with buffalo sauce, absolutely delicious! Melt in your mouth!! Drink counter is retro with lots to choose from. Very clean and we will go back to try some more of their menu especially the chicken tenders. I suggest you go before noon as the place is very popular right now.

data.title: Average - trying to be a fast casual place
data.text:
The good - it's decent food.
The bad - there is NOTHING special about it at all. Basically a very upscale mcdonalds. Not sure we need another one. The tenders are GOOD, but they don't stand out. You can find nuggets at Mickey D's for a lot cheaper and you get more and the taste is just as good. I had the blueberry cole slaw. Good concept, but I thought it would be INFUSED with the blueberry. Not so, they toss in some blueberries. There's virtually no taste otherwise. I found the place to be bland and boring. Nice try, though.

data.title: Eat fresh
data.text: This was my first visit to this new restaurant in Pembroke Pines.  People were standing in line waiting to order and the drive-up was very busy.  The restaurant was packed with people, especially families. Food was very good.  I had the grilled chicken salad with blueberry vinaigrette dressing.  A side order of blueberry Cole slaw and an iced green tea.  The restaurant was very loud with music playing.  Hard to talk above the music and crowd.  My suggestion would be to cut the music during peak hours.  Also do away with the salt and pepper shakers.  In this humid climate it is difficult to get salt out of the shaker.  I would suggest salt and pepper packets.  If you are in the mood for healthy fast food for your family then this is a great place.

data.title: PDQ Hmmm,  Hmmm Good!
data.text: I am a fast food snob.  There, I said it.   My fast food choice is limited and I tend to favor Chick-Fil-A.  Was looking forward to trying out PDQ and this is my second time for lunch.  I started by ordering just their Cali Club Sandwich and was impressed.  Went back and ordered the same but meal.  Fries are just okay.  Both orders were drive thru which was easy.  Staff Friendly.  But the quality of the chicken is delicious.  You can tell it is fresh chicken.  I will definitely go back with my family.

data.title: It's OK
data.text: The chicken tenders were good. I was not impressed with the fries or milk shakes. The employees are nice but get the orders wrong often.
